result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on August 27, 2015 - Alis A. Fox

Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied. Plea agreement put into the record.  Case No. 14CF80 - defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 2 - possession of drug paraphernalia and count 3 - disorderly conduct-domestic abuse.  14CF82 defendant enters a plea of no contest to the amended charge of Count 1 - conspiracy to manufacture meth (10-50) grams and Count 5 - possession of meth paraphernalia.  Plea freely and knowingly.   Court finds defendant guilty.  Court dismisses and read in remaining counts in 14CF80 and 14CF82 and dismisses and read in Case Nos. 14CF78, 14CM82, 14CM91 and 15CM52.   Statement by victim.  Statement by attorneys.  14CF80 - Court orders court costs on each count; DNA surcharge on Count 2 only; 30 days county jail with good time on Count 3 only; concurrent to 14CF82.  14CF83 court orders count 1 - 5 years initial confinement followed by four years of extended supervision.  Count 5 - 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision. Conditions of court costs on each count; DNA sample and surcharge; no contact with T.A.; J.H.; R.H. or A.K.; AODA and follow all treatment recommendations; any other counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; 324 days sentence credit.  Defendant is eligible for CIP/ERP.  - rt

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Bachman appeared in person.  Gerald Pearson appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Tlusty indicated to the court that they have reached an agreement for all of Mr. Pearson's cases.  Judge indicated that he had no objection to the agreement.  Judge indicated that the jury trial for Thursday be taken off of the calendar and will now be a plea and sentencing that day at 10:00 a.m.  Attorney Tlusty voiced her concern regarding the defendant changing his mind.  Mr. Pearson indicated to the court that if he changed his mind he would not get a speedy trial.  Judge indicated to call off the jurors and witnesses.  - rt

to Gerald L. Pearson - Notice of Hearing - no forwarding address - resent to him at the Taylor County Jail

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with T.J.A. - dob:  9-9-85.

Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in court with attorney John Charles Bachman by phone.   Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Bachman will be filing a request for a substitution of judge.  Waive reading of complaint.   Defendant does not want Mr. Bachman as his attorney.  Mr. Pearson is entering a plea of not guilty to the charges.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $500.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with T.J.A. - dob:  9-9-85.  So ordered by the court.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  - rt
